text: so is aerobic exercise specifically
running the best way to lose fat
ultimately running does use fat for fuel
now is it the most efficient way to do
this well it's a little bit of a loaded
question because ultimately unless you
change your diet and some other factors
that go into your workout running alone
is not going to be the only thing that
makes you lose fat but I'm not sure when
cardio exercise became the carbs of the
fitness world it's not a bad thing but
ultimately it can't be the only thing
you rely on so what's the best bet
include resistance training with it I'm
not saying don't run but building some
additional muscle to help support you as
well and modifying your diet in a way
supports the proper macronutrient intake
at the right times is going to do a lot
more for you than just running it's hard
to outrun a bad diet and that's the
reality
so does running actually burn fat yes it
does is it the only way to lose fat no
and by itself it may not be enough
